com.gsma.mobileconnect.discovery

Interface IDiscovery

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DiscoveryImpl

    public interface IDiscovery
    Interface for discovering operator end points that are used for OpenID Connect authorization.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • startAutomatedOperatorDiscovery

        void startAutomatedOperatorDiscovery(java.lang.String clientId,
                                   java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                   java.lang.String discoveryURL,
                                   java.lang.String redirectURL,
                                   DiscoveryOptions options,
                                   java.util.List<KeyValuePair> currentCookies,
                                   IDiscoveryResponseCallback callback)
                                     throws DiscoveryException
        Allows an application to conduct discovery based on the predetermined operator/network identified operator semantics.

        If the operator cannot be identified the function will return the 'operator selection' form of the response. The application can then determine how to proceed i.e. open the operator selection page separately or otherwise handle this.

        The operator selection functionality will display a series of pages that enables the user to identify an operator, the results are passed back to the current application as parameters on the redirect URL.

        Valid discovery responses can be cached and this method can return cached data.

        Parameters:
        clientId - The registered application client id. (Required).
        clientSecret - The registered application client secret. (Required).
        discoveryURL - The URL of the discovery end point. (Required).
        redirectURL - The URL the operator selection functionality redirects to. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        currentCookies - List of current cookies the browser has sent. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        DiscoveryException

      • startAutomatedOperatorDiscovery

        void startAutomatedOperatorDiscovery(IPreferences preferences,
                                   java.lang.String redirectURL,
                                   DiscoveryOptions options,
                                   java.util.List<KeyValuePair> currentCookies,
                                   IDiscoveryResponseCallback callback)
                                     throws DiscoveryException
        A convenience version of startAutomatedOperatorDiscovery(String, String, String, String, DiscoveryOptions, List, IDiscoveryResponseCallback) where the clientId, clientSecret and discoveryURL parameters are read from an IPreferences implementation.
        Parameters:
        preferences - Instance of IPreferences that provides clientId, clientSecret and discoveryURL. (Required).
        redirectURL - The URL the operator selection functionality redirects to. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        currentCookies - List of current cookies the browser has sent. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        DiscoveryException

      • getOperatorSelectionURL

        void getOperatorSelectionURL(java.lang.String clientId,
                           java.lang.String clientSecret,
                           java.lang.String discoveryURL,
                           java.lang.String redirectURL,
                           TimeoutOptions options,
                           IDiscoveryResponseCallback callback)
                             throws DiscoveryException
        Allows an application to get the URL for the operator selection UI of the discovery service.

        This will not reference the discovery result cache.

        The returned URL will contain a session id created by the discovery server. The URL must be used as-is.

        Parameters:
        clientId - The registered application client id. (Required).
        clientSecret - The registered application client secret. (Required).
        discoveryURL - The URL of the discovery end point. (Required).
        redirectURL - The URL the operator selection functionality redirects to. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        DiscoveryException

      • getOperatorSelectionURL

        void getOperatorSelectionURL(IPreferences preferences,
                           java.lang.String redirectURL,
                           TimeoutOptions options,
                           IDiscoveryResponseCallback callback)
                             throws DiscoveryException
        A convenience version of getOperatorSelectionURL(String, String, String, String, TimeoutOptions, IDiscoveryResponseCallback) where the clientId, clientSecret and discoveryURL parameters are read from an IPreferences implementation.
        Parameters:
        preferences - Instance of IPreferences that provides clientId, clientSecret and discoveryURL. (Required).
        redirectURL - The URL the operator selection functionality redirects to. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        DiscoveryException

      • parseDiscoveryRedirect

        void parseDiscoveryRedirect(java.lang.String redirectURL,
                          IParsedDiscoveryRedirectCallback callback)
                            throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Allows an application to obtain parameters which have been passed within a discovery redirect URL.

        The function will parse the redirectURL and parse out the components expected for discovery i.e.

        • selectedMCC
        • selectedMNC
        • encryptedMSISDN
        Parameters:
        redirectURL - The URL which has been subject to redirection from the discovery service. (Required).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException

      • completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery

        void completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery(java.lang.String clientId,
                                     java.lang.String clientSecret,
                                     java.lang.String discoveryURL,
                                     java.lang.String redirectURL,
                                     java.lang.String selectedMCC,
                                     java.lang.String selectedMNC,
                                     CompleteSelectedOperatorDiscoveryOptions options,
                                     java.util.List<KeyValuePair> currentCookies,
                                     IDiscoveryResponseCallback callback)
                                       throws DiscoveryException
        Allows an application to use the selected operator MCC and MNC to obtain the discovery response.

        In the case there is already a discovery result in the cache and the Selected-MCC/Selected-MNC in the new request are the same as relates to the discovery result for the cached result, the cached result will be returned.

        If the operator cannot be identified by the discovery service the function will return the 'operator selection' form of the response.

        Parameters:
        clientId - The registered application client id. (Required).
        clientSecret - The registered application client secret. (Required).
        discoveryURL - The URL of the discovery end point. (Required).
        redirectURL - The URL the operator selection functionality redirects to. If not specified http://localhost is assumed. (Optional).
        selectedMCC - The MCC of the selected operator. (Required).
        selectedMNC - The MNC of the selected operator. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        currentCookies - List of current cookies the browser has sent. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        DiscoveryException

      • completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery

        void completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery(IPreferences preferences,
                                     java.lang.String redirectURL,
                                     java.lang.String selectedMCC,
                                     java.lang.String selectedMNC,
                                     CompleteSelectedOperatorDiscoveryOptions options,
                                     java.util.List<KeyValuePair> currentCookies,
                                     IDiscoveryResponseCallback callback)
                                       throws DiscoveryException
        A convenience version of completeSelectedOperatorDiscovery(String, String, String, String, String, String, CompleteSelectedOperatorDiscoveryOptions, List, IDiscoveryResponseCallback) where the clientId, clientSecret and discoveryURL parameters are read from an IPreferences implementation.
        Parameters:
        preferences - Instance of IPreferences that provides clientId, clientSecret and discoveryURL. (Required).
        redirectURL - The URL the operator selection functionality redirects to. If not specified http://localhost is assumed. (Optional).
        selectedMCC - The MCC of the selected operator. (Required).
        selectedMNC - The MNC of the selected operator. (Required).
        options - Optional parameters. (Optional).
        currentCookies - List of current cookies the browser has sent. (Optional).
        callback - Used to capture the response. (Required).
        Throws:
        DiscoveryException

      • isOperatorSelectionRequired

        boolean isOperatorSelectionRequired(DiscoveryResponse discoveryResult)
        Simple helper function which inspects the (JSON) returned from a discovery SDK call to check if the operator selection UI should be displayed.

        Returns true or false value. True is returned only if discoveryResult contains the operator selection URL. False if discoveryResult is null or contains expired discovery data.

        Parameters:
        discoveryResult - The discovery response to parse. (Required)
        Returns:
        True if the discovery response contains an operator selection URL, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the discovery response is not recognised.

      • extractOperatorSelectionURL

        java.lang.String extractOperatorSelectionURL(DiscoveryResponse discoveryResult)
        Extract the operator selection URL from the discovery response.
        Parameters:
        discoveryResult - The discovery response to parse.
        Returns:
        The operator selection url or null.

      • isErrorResponse

        boolean isErrorResponse(DiscoveryResponse discoveryResult)
        Returns true if the discovery response contains an error response
        Parameters:
        discoveryResult - The discovery response to check
        Returns:
        True if the discovery response contains an error object.

      • getErrorResponse

        ErrorResponse getErrorResponse(DiscoveryResponse discoveryResult)
        Extract the error from the Discovery response if present.
        Parameters:
        discoveryResult - The discovery response to parse.
        Returns:
        The error response if any, null otherwise.

      • getCachedDiscoveryResult

        DiscoveryResponse getCachedDiscoveryResult(java.lang.String mcc,
                                         java.lang.String mnc)
        Simple function which retrieves (if available) from the discovery result cache a discovery result which corresponds with the operator details specified.
        Parameters:
        mcc - The operator mcc. (Required).
        mnc - The operator mnc. (Required).
        Returns:
        A cached entry if available, null otherwise.

      • clearDiscoveryCache

        void clearDiscoveryCache(CacheOptions options)
        Simple function which clears any result from the discovery cache which corresponds with the various options specified.
        Parameters:
        options - Optional parameters, if not specified all entries are removed from the cache. (Optional).
